intro: Limonium echioides, commonly known as sea helene, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Limonium echioides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and vibrant floral display.
